articles.title: Sri Lankan Fishermen Urged to Stay Ashore as Monsoon Winds Intensify
articles.author: Zulfick Farzan
articles.summary: The Department of Meteorology has issued a Red Alert warning for strong winds and rough seas around Sri Lanka. The warning is effective from 12:30 p.m. on May 30 until midnight on May 31, 2025. It applies to the sea areas off the coast from Chilaw to Kankasanthurai via Puttalam and Mannar and from Galle to Pottuvil via Hambantota.

articles.title: Sri Lanka Air Force Sends Helicopter To Rescue Fishermen

articles.title: Record Heatwave Forecast for U.S. Summer 2025: States Issue Warnings
articles.summary: The summer forecast shows the United States might endure some of its hottest temperatures yet. Several states are likely to experience heat waves from June to August. Texas, Arizona, Florida, and California are seeing some of the most problems. A shortage of spring rainfall in the Rockies and Sierra Nevada has made snow melt faster, raising the fire hazard in California, Nevada, and Colorado. Some parts of Minnesota and the mid-Atlantic are already dealing with wildfires and conditions that should appear weeks later. The combined challenges of heat, drought, and fire are distressing emergency teams.
